forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 49. West northwest wind 3 to 9 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Slight Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain after 5pm. Mostly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind 3 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the weather settles into a cool embrace, with a hint of moisture lingering in the air. Tonight, partly cloudy skies blanket the city, offering a low around fifty degrees that speaks to the gentle chill of early spring. The west northwest winds whisper softly, a mere murmur between three to nine miles per hour, adding to the serene ambiance of the evening. While some urban lights begin to flicker into life, the persistent promise of a slight chance of rain lingers in the afternoon air of tomorrow, with expectations of sunshine before the clouds gather again.

The present conditions appear tranquil, yet there’s an unmistakable clarity that hints at the encroachment of the marine layer. The fog, ever the elusive dancer in this coastal city, may be lurking in the edges, ready to roll in and shroud familiar views in mystery, but for now, it remains at bay. Dressed in layers, with a soft sweater and a light jacket, one could venture forth into the neighborhood, perhaps stopping by a cozy café for an espresso or a stroll along the waterfront, where the horizon meets the shimmering bay. The evening invites introspection and conversation, making it an ideal time to explore the lesser-known streets and hidden gems of this vibrant city before the rain arrives to refresh the air once more.
